english: a form made by lining up pieces of wood and binding them together

etymology.description: Depicts bamboo slips strung together -> represents a form made by lining up pieces of wood and binding them together
etymology.interpretation: This character 昔(昔) (xié, "now obsolete"), depicted bamboo slips tied together, a common method for creating books or records in ancient China.
etymology.simplification: 册(冊) is a variant form derived as a stylized representation of the traditional 冊(冊), retaining the same layout but with simplified strokes.

examples.chinese: 师傅将木片整齐排列(師傅將木片整齊排列)，合成了一冊申请表(合成了一冊申請表)。
examples.pinyin: Shīfù jiāng mùpiàn zhěngqí páiliè, héchéngle yī cè shēnqǐngbiǎo.
examples.english: The master neatly arranged the wood pieces and combined them into a form for applications.

examples.chinese: 古代官员用木片制冊(古代官員用木片製冊)，登记户籍(登記戶籍)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdài guānyuán yòng mùpiàn zhì cè, dēngjì hùjí.
examples.english: In ancient times, officials used wood pieces to make forms for recording households.

examples.chinese: 图书馆保存着一本古老的冊(圖書館保存著一本古老的冊)，记载着地方风俗(記載著地方風俗)。
examples.pinyin: Túshūguǎn bǎocún zhe yī běn gǔlǎo de cè, jìzǎi zhe dìfāng fēngsú.
examples.english: The library preserves an ancient form that records local customs.
